intro: Eriophyton lamiiflorum, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes across tropical regions.
